meanings.definition: To watch over and direct (an undertaking or group of people)
meanings.sent1: The teacher oversees the students during recess to ensure they play safely.
meanings.sent2: The manager oversees the construction project to make sure it stays on schedule.
meanings.sent3: The cat oversees the mice playing in the garden, ready to pounce at any moment.
meanings.sent4: As the captain of the ship, he oversees the crew's every move like a hawk.
meanings.sent5: The security guard oversees the entrance, checking everyone who comes in.

meanings.definition: To supervise or manage (a process or activity)
meanings.sent1: She oversees the baking of the cake to ensure it turns out perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The CEO oversees the company's finances to keep it profitable.
meanings.sent3: The robot oversees the assembly line, making sure each part is in place.
meanings.sent4: The director oversees the film production, ensuring everything runs smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The coach oversees the team's training, pushing them to reach their full potential.
